Task:
  The response assigns items to predefined or inferred categories with consistent application of category definitions.
constraints: Completeness ("full"): The response provides a thorough answer for normal use, covering all major aspects without needing every micro-detail.
Scope ("good"): The response focuses on how quality, success, or goodness is judged—criteria, metrics, value, taste, or standards of assessment.
Method ("systemic"): The response analyses the subject as a whole system, including components, boundaries, flows, and feedback loops.
Form ("code"): The response consists only of code or markup for the main answer, with no surrounding natural-language explanation.

Directional ("fip bog"): The response moves between abstract principles and concrete examples, examines their structural patterns and reflects on them, then identifies actions and extends them to related contexts.
